title: Q Methodology-Based Subjectivity Analysis of Instructional Design Stakeholders

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary education foundational theories and basic instructional design principles
context.additional_context: Learning systematic analysis of learner subjectivity in elementary education contexts through VR simulations, targeting competency enhancement for students/job seekers

learning_goals: Learners will be able to derive three or more subjective perspective profiles for educational participants by applying Q methodology procedures.
Learners will be able to write an interpretation report by combining qualitative data collected in simulation/VR environments with quantitative analysis tools.
Learners will be able to propose two or more instructional design strategies optimized for learner characteristics based on analysis results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
